properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 26 at 4:14PM AKST until January 27 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of
6 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. Whiteout
conditions expected at times.

* WHERE...Thompson Pass.

* WHEN...From 1 AM to 9 PM AKST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold
wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on
exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are
expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds
and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout
conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel,
have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay
with your vehicle.

For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit
511.alaska.gov.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 9 PM AKST MONDAY FOR THOMPSON PASS
